intro: Chromolaena pellia, commonly known as the hairy chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields due to its adaptability. It has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Chromolaena pellia is also known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
